DataElement.preferredName: MRI Variable Flip Angle Yes No Text Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Flip angle variation applied during image acquisition. Enumerated Values:  Y = yes; N = no

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Variable Flip Angle
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Steady state angle in degrees to which the magnetic vector is flipped from the magnetic vector of the primary field.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: Marked by diversity or difference; liable to or capable of change.:In magnetic resonance imaging, the rotation of the average axis of the protons, relative to the main magnetic field direction, induced by radiofrequency signals.

Concepts.definition: Marked by diversity or difference; liable to or capable of change.
In magnetic resonance imaging, the rotation of the average axis of the protons, relative to the main magnetic field direction, induced by radiofrequency signals.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/14/14 - Released as part of caBIG Draft Content review; related to DICOM CDE; removed Breast caBIG ACRIN CSI. jc  5/21/08 - created for ACRIN DCE-MRI data element

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Response of Y (Yes) or N (No) to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
